channel.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
channel.description:
I'm running Whonix on Virtualbox and Linux Mint. I opened the gateway then workstation. I tried to download Tor and open it and get the folling message:
ERROR: User home folder permission issue?
Failed to run the following command:
cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/
Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate. That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See: EDITED LINK OUT
To fix this, you could try: Start Menu -> System -> Xfce Terminal
sudo chown --recursive "user":"user" "/home/user"
Then try starting Tor Browser again.
To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in: EDITED LINK OUT
See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues: EDITED LINK OUT
-- I tried entering the commands in all the terminals. I'm new to Linux. Downloading Tor on Mint wasn't straightforward as the site was blocked. I had to get a VPN first. I wondered if the problem is related to that but I tried to open the other browser in Whonix and that doesn't work either.
Many thanks for any help in advance.

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
A post was split to a new topic: Tor Bootstrap Issue

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Try installing Tor Browser now. Since the broken permission folders should be gone, installation should work. You’ll find it in start menu.

If you try starting Tor Browser and it’s not installed, it should be asking to install it. Should hopefully now be easy either way.

Thank you! The debug output you posted will help to integrate debugging into Whonix Tor Browser startup script to debug such issues in future. I’ll also probably soon have a command which would fix such issues.

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
37874938:

cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/
cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/temp’: Permission denied
cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/files’: Permission denied
cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/tbb_version_last_downloaded_save_file’: Permission denied

Could you please provide the following debug output?

cd ~ 

touch test1

cp --verbose test1 test2

ls -la /home

ls -la /home/user

ls -la /home/user/.cache

ls -la /home/user/.cache/tb

ls -la /home/user/.cache/tb/temp

ls -la /home/user/.cache/tb/files

ls -la /home/user/.cache/tb/tbb_version_last_downloaded_save_file

To fix, delete Tor Browser.

sudo rm -r -v -f /var/cache/tb-binary

sudo rm -r -v -f /home/user/.cache/tb

sudo rm -r -v -f /home/user/.tb

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.description:
user@host:~$ bash -x torbrowser

  • set -e
  • set -o pipefail
  • set -o errtrace
  • ‘[’ -f /usr/lib/helper-scripts/pre.bsh ‘]’
  • source /usr/lib/helper-scripts/pre.bsh
    ++ set -o errtrace
    +++ mktemp
    ++ TEMP_FILE_PRE_BSH=/tmp/tmp.HkJCGTRiKs
    ++ test -o xtrace
    ++ true ‘INFO: Setting DEBDEBUG to 1, because xtrace (-x) is set.’
    ++ DEBDEBUG=1
    ++ ‘[’ 1 = 1 ‘]’
    ++ set -x
    ++ ‘[’ ‘’ = true ‘]’
    ++ colors
    ++ ‘[’ xterm-256color = ‘’ ‘]’
    ++ [[ -t 2 ]]
    +++ type -t errorhandlergeneral
    ++ ‘[’ ‘’ = function ‘]’
    +++ trap -p ERR
    ++ ‘[’ ‘’ = ‘’ ‘]’
    ++ trap error_handler_pre ERR
    ++ bash -n /usr/lib/helper-scripts/pre.bsh
    ++ bash -n torbrowser
    ++ own_filename=torbrowser
    ++ source_config_folder
    ++ ‘[’ ‘’ = ‘’ ‘]’
    ++ pre_bsh_settings_folder=torbrowser_pre.d
    ++ shopt -s nullglob
    ++ local i
    ++ true ‘folder 1: /etc/torbrowser_pre.d/.conf’
    ++ true 'folder 2: /usr/local/etc/torbrowser_pre.d/    .conf’
    ++ shopt -u nullglob
    ++ check_scripts_to_skip
    ++ local skip_script
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
    ++ basename /usr/bin/torbrowser
  • SCRIPTNAME=torbrowser
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • IDENTIFIER=torbrowser
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • ICON=/usr/share/icons/anon-icon-pack/tbupdate.ico
  • trap tb_error_handler ERR
  • tb_run_function main_function
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running main_function, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • main_function
  • tb_run_function root_check
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running root_check, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • root_check
    ++ id -u
  • ‘[’ 1000 ‘!=’ 0 ‘]’
  • true
  • tb_run_function tb_preparation
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running tb_preparation, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • tb_preparation
    ++ whoami
  • who_ami=user
  • command -v qubesdb-read
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • is_qubes=false
  • test -f /run/qubes/this-is-templatevm
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_user_home=/home/user
  • echo /home/user
  • grep -q tor-browser
    ++ dirname /home/user
  • tb_user_home_dirname=/home
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_install_folder=tb
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_install_folder_dot=.tb
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_browser_name=tor-browser
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_settings_folder=torbrowser.d
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_title=‘Tor Browser’
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_wiki=Tor_Browser
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_bin=torbrowser
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_browser_runner=start-tor-browser
  • ‘[’ -n torbrowser ‘]’
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_home_folder=/home/user/.tb
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_browser_folder=/home/user/.tb/tor-browser
  • ‘[’ -n ‘’ ‘]’
  • tb_user_js_target_file=/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/Browser/profile.default/user.js
  • ‘[’ -n /usr/share/homepage/whonix-welcome-page/whonix.html ‘]’
  • export TOR_DEFAULT_HOMEPAGE
  • ‘[’ ‘’ = ‘’ ‘]’
  • ‘[’ :0.0 = ‘’ ‘]’
  • display=:0.0
  • output=/usr/lib/msgcollector/msgcollector
  • local my_tty
  • local my_tty_exit_code
  • my_tty_exit_code=0
    ++ tty
  • my_tty=/dev/pts/0
  • ‘[’ ‘!’ 0 = 0 ‘]’
  • ‘[’ /dev/pts/0 = ‘’ ‘]’
    ++ whoami
  • who_ami=user
  • output_opt_1=’–icon /usr/share/icons/anon-icon-pack/tbupdate.ico’
  • output_opt_2=’–parentpid 1276’
  • output_opt_3=’–identifier torbrowser’
  • output_opt_4=’–parenttty /dev/pts/0’
  • output_opt_5=’–whoami user’
  • output_opts=("$output_opt_1" “$output_opt_2” “$output_opt_3” “$output_opt_4” “$output_opt_5”)
  • TITLE=‘Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers)’
  • tb_run_function tb_config_folder_parser
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running tb_config_folder_parser, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • tb_config_folder_parser
  • ‘[’ -n torbrowser.d ‘]’
  • shopt -s nullglob
  • local i
  • for i in /etc/${tb_settings_folder}/.conf /rw/config/${tb_settings_folder}/.conf /usr/local/etc/${tb_settings_folder}/*.conf
  • bash -n /etc/torbrowser.d/30_default.conf
  • source /etc/torbrowser.d/30_default.conf
  • local j
  • for j in /etc/${tb_settings_folder}/user.js /usr/local/etc/${tb_settings_folder}/user.js
  • test -r /etc/torbrowser.d/user.js
  • continue
  • for j in /etc/${tb_settings_folder}/user.js /usr/local/etc/${tb_settings_folder}/user.js
  • test -r /usr/local/etc/torbrowser.d/user.js
  • continue
  • tb_run_function tb_templatevm_check
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running tb_templatevm_check, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • tb_templatevm_check
  • ‘[’ false = false ‘]’
  • true ‘Not running in Qubes.’
  • return 0
  • tb_run_function tb_qubes_dvm_template
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running tb_qubes_dvm_template, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • tb_qubes_dvm_template
  • echo ‘’
  • grep -q --invert-match ‘-dvm’
  • true ‘INFO: not running inside Qubes DVM Template, ok.’
  • return 0
  • tb_run_function check_tb_updater_first_boot_done
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running check_tb_updater_first_boot_done, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • check_tb_updater_first_boot_done
  • test -f /run/qubes/this-is-templatevm
  • local systemctl_output
  • local wait_counter
  • wait_counter=0
  • true
    ++ systemctl --no-pager --no-block status tb-updater-first-boot.service
  • systemctl_output=‘● tb-updater-first-boot.service - Helper Service for /usr/bin/torbrowser to determine when it is save to Copy Tor Browser from /var/cache/tb-binary to user home by Whonix developers
    Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/tb-updater-first-boot.service; enabled; vendor preset: enabled)
    Active: active (exited) since Mon 2021-08-30 09:51:25 UTC; 3min 53s ago
    Docs: GitHub - Whonix/tb-updater: Tor Browser Downloader - Automates download and verification of Tor Br
    Process: 434 ExecStart=/bin/true (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
    Main PID: 434 (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)’
  • break
  • tb_run_function tb_copy_from_root_to_user_maybe
  • case $tb_skip_functions in
  • true ‘INFO: Running tb_copy_from_root_to_user_maybe, because tb_skip_functions does not include it.’
  • tb_copy_from_root_to_user_maybe
  • ‘[’ ‘’ = none ‘]’
  • local done_file
  • done_file=/home/user/.tb/first-boot-home-population.done
  • ‘[’ ‘!’ -d /home/user ‘]’
  • ‘[’ ‘!’ -d /var/cache/tb-binary ‘]’
  • ‘[’ -d /home/user/.tb/tor-browser ‘]’
  • ‘[’ -e /home/user/.tb/first-boot-home-population.done ‘]’
  • ‘[’ -d /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache ‘]’
  • mkdir -p /home/user/.cache
  • test -w /home/user/.cache
  • cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/
    cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/temp’: Permission denied
    cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/files’: Permission denied
    cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/tbb_version_last_downloaded_save_file’: Permission denied
  • tb_permission_issue cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/
  • local ‘failed_command=cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/’
  • local ‘MSG=

    User home folder permission issue?





    Failed to run the following command:





    cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/





    Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate.


    That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Root#Inappropriate_Use_of_Root_Rights





    To fix this, you could try:

    Start Menu → System → Xfce Terminal





    sudo chown --recursive “user”:“user” “/home/user”



    Then try starting Tor Browser again.





    To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#In_Verbose_Mode.





    See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Permission_Issues

    ’
  • /usr/lib/msgcollector/msgcollector --icon /usr/share/icons/anon-icon-pack/tbupdate.ico --parentpid 1276 --identifier torbrowser --parenttty /dev/pts/0 --whoami user --messagex --typex error --titlex ‘Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers)’ --message ‘

    User home folder permission issue?





    Failed to run the following command:





    cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/





    Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate.


    That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Root#Inappropriate_Use_of_Root_Rights





    To fix this, you could try:

    Start Menu → System → Xfce Terminal





    sudo chown --recursive “user”:“user” “/home/user”



    Then try starting Tor Browser again.





    To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#In_Verbose_Mode.





    See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Permission_Issues

    ’ --done
  • /usr/lib/msgcollector/msgcollector --icon /usr/share/icons/anon-icon-pack/tbupdate.ico --parentpid 1276 --identifier torbrowser --parenttty /dev/pts/0 --whoami user --messagecli --typecli error --titlecli ‘Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers)’ --message ‘

    User home folder permission issue?





    Failed to run the following command:





    cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/





    Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate.


    That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Root#Inappropriate_Use_of_Root_Rights





    To fix this, you could try:

    Start Menu → System → Xfce Terminal





    sudo chown --recursive “user”:“user” “/home/user”



    Then try starting Tor Browser again.





    To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#In_Verbose_Mode.





    See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues:


    https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Permission_Issues

    ’ --done
    [ERROR] [torbrowser] User home folder permission issue?

Failed to run the following command:

cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/

Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate.
That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See:

Whonix – 10 Aug 21

Safely Use Root Commands

Tips on using sudo / root (privileged) commands safely

To fix this, you could try: Start Menu → System → Xfce Terminal

sudo chown --recursive “user”:“user” “/home/user”
Then try starting Tor Browser again.

To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in:
Tor Browser Essentials.

See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues:

Whonix – 28 Aug 21

Tor Browser Essentials

Using Tor Browser in Whonix ™. Anonymity vs Pseudonymity, HTTPS Everywhere, Torbutton, Protection against dangerous JavaScript, NoScript, Tips, Update Tor Browser, Browser Plugins, Change Language

  • exit 1
    user@host:~$ nix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Permission_Issues
    bash: nix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Permission_Issues: No such file or directory
    user@host:~$ + exit 1
    bash: +: command not found
    user@host:~$ user@host:~$
    bash: user@host:~$: command not found
    user@host:~$

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
37874938:

Start Menu → Xfce Terminal

Don’t copy that into the terminal. These are instructions to follow. Not things to paste into terminal. I.e. click on the start menu, then open Xfce terminal.

37874938:

user@host:~$

You already have a terminal open. No need to start another.

Read full topic

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#In_Verbose_Mode

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.description:
Patrick:

sudo chown --recursive user:user /home/user

Workstation terminal:

user@host:~$ sudo chown --recursive user:user /home/user
[sudo] password for user:
user@host:~$

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
See https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Permission_Issues

Run the following command to reset permissions of user user's home folder /home/user back to owner user and group user.

sudo chown --recursive user:user /home/user

The full output of that command is required.

Attempt to debug:

  • Start Tor Browser Start by Whonix ™ in In Verbose Mode. This will show verbose output messages which might be useful for the user to identify the issue. In doubt, Support might help interpreting these messages.

Then also the link from there

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#In_Verbose_Mode

Run that command and also post that output here.

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.description:
I think this is what you mean when you say debug output:

user@host:~$ cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/
cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/temp’: Permission denied
cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/files’: Permission denied
cp: cannot stat ‘/home/user/.cache/tb/tbb_version_last_downloaded_save_file’: Permission denied
user@host:~$

Sorry, I mean Tor Browser is the main problem here.

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
When debugging this, you also need to post the debug output.

Tip: Please do not accidentally substitute Tor for a question related to Tor Browser, as this causes confusion.

37874938:

Downloading Tor on Mint wasn’t straightforward as the site was blocked. I had to get a VPN first. I wondered if the problem is related to that but I tried to open the other browser in Whonix and that doesn’t work either.

Not related to user home folder permission issues.

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix

item.title: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
item.description:
I’m running Whonix on Virtualbox and Linux Mint. I opened the gateway then workstation. I tried to download Tor and open it and get the folling message:

ERROR: User home folder permission issue?

Failed to run the following command:

cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.cache /home/user/

Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate.
That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See:
EDITED LINK OUT

To fix this, you could try:
Start Menu → System → Xfce Terminal

sudo chown --recursive “user”:“user” “/home/user”

Then try starting Tor Browser again.

To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in:
EDITED LINK OUT

See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues:
EDITED LINK OUT

–
I tried entering the commands in all the terminals. I’m new to Linux. Downloading Tor on Mint wasn’t straightforward as the site was blocked. I had to get a VPN first. I wondered if the problem is related to that but I tried to open the other browser in Whonix and that doesn’t work either.

Many thanks for any help in advance.

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser Not Working in Whonix
